title: Ticket #7411: Send fewer attributes in session resuming classad
description:
When we resume a session, in either TCP or UDP, CEDAR looks up the session and sends the entire ClassAd. This is not necessary, and we really only need to send a subset of attributes that are ever potentially looked at. The list of attributes we need to send (because they are looked at) are:
  • ATTR_SEC_USE_SESSION
  • ATTR_SEC_SID
  • ATTR_SEC_COMMAND
  • ATTR_SEC_AUTH_COMMAND
  • ATTR_SEC_SERVER_COMMAND_SOCK
  • ATTR_SEC_CONNECT_SINFUL
  • ATTR_SEC_COOKIE

As Jaime pointed out, putClassAd can already take a projection so the code is quite straightforward.
remarks:
2019-Dec-04 14:48:31 by jfrey:
putClassAd() takes a whitelist of attributes to send over CEDAR, so no need to construct a separate ClassAd object.

2019-Dec-04 16:47:50 by jfrey:
Code Review

We should build the projection of session attribute names once in SecMan, then use it when needed.

2019-Dec-06 16:10:46 by zmiller:
Thanks, Jaime. Reworked the code as you suggested. Please re-review.

2020-Jan-02 11:24:24 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Quick addition to Jaime's code review above....

There are "ZKM" dprintfs in this commit. Even worse, there are ZKM dprintfs that are D_ALWAYS in code that is expected to always be hit. Adding insult to injury, there are ZKM dprintfs that have spelling mistakes.

Lets make a point of always remembering to remove development debugging cruft please. D_ALWAYS should be reserved for problems / errors / wrap-up of major events, not for small "I made it here in the code" business as usual messages. Developer initials should never appear in code that gets merged into our master branch.

2020-Jan-02 15:21:11 by zmiller:
Fully agree with Todd. There was one leftover dprintf that was committed by accident, and has now been removed.

2020-Jan-02 15:27:44 by jfrey:
Code Review

The code looks good now.

2020-Feb-18 13:48:53 by jfrey:
Zach and Jaime believe this small performance improvement doesn't merit a version history entry.
2020-Apr-10 07:46:37 by tim:
Bulk change of target version from v080906 to v080907 using ticket-target-mover.
